description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 1.1.2.3 Configure /home

controls.title: Ensure separate partition exists for /home
controls.description: The /home directory is used to support disk storage needs of local users. Separating /home from the root filesystem ensures that processes cannot exhaust all available space on the root filesystem.
controls.remediation: Create a separate partition for /home and add it to /etc/fstab

controls.title: Ensure nodev option set on /home partition
controls.description: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices. This prevents device files from being created in /home.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nodev to the mount options for /home

controls.title: Ensure nosuid option set on /home partition
controls.description: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files. This prevents setuid files from being executed from /home.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nosuid to the mount options for /home
